openerp.data:
stock.inventory.line.tree stock.inventory.line tree
stock.inventory.line.form stock.inventory.line form

stock.inventory.tree stock.inventory tree
stock.inventory.form stock.inventory form
Physical Inventories ir.actions.act_window stock.inventory form
Periodical Inventories are used to count the number of products available per location. You can use it once a year when you do the general inventory or whenever you need it, to correct the current stock level of a product.
Draft Physical Inventories ir.actions.act_window stock.inventory form [('state','=','draft')]
stock.tracking.form stock.tracking form
stock.tracking.tree stock.tracking tree
Packs ir.actions.act_window stock.tracking form
This is the list of all your packs. When you select a Pack, you can get the upstream or downstream traceability of the products contained in the pack.
stock.tracking.tree stock.tracking tree child_ids
Pack Search stock.tracking search
stock.production.lot.revision.form stock.production.lot.revision form
stock.production.lot.revision.tree stock.production.lot.revision tree
stock.production.lot.form stock.production.lot form
stock.production.lot.tree stock.production.lot tree
Production Lots Filter stock.production.lot search
Serial Number ir.actions.act_window stock.production.lot form
{} This is the list of all the production lots (serial numbers) you recorded. When you select a lot, you can get the upstream or downstream traceability of the products contained in lot. By default, the list is filtred on the serial numbers that are available in your warehouse but you can uncheck the 'Available' button to get all the lots you produced, received or delivered to customers.
# # Lot composition (history) #
Stock Moves stock.move tree move_history_ids
Stock Moves stock.move tree move_history_ids2
Downstream traceability ir.actions.act_window stock.move [('id','in',active_ids)] tree
tree_but_action stock.move Downstream traceability
Upstream traceability ir.actions.act_window stock.move [('id','in',active_ids)] tree
tree_but_action stock.move Upstream traceability
stock.location.form stock.location form
stock.location.search stock.location search
stock.location.tree stock.location tree
Locations stock.location ir.actions.act_window form
{'search_default_in_location':1} Define your locations to reflect your warehouse structure and organization. OpenERP is able to manage physical locations (warehouses, shelves, bin, etc), partner locations (customers, suppliers) and virtual locations which are the counterpart of the stock operations like the manufacturing orders consumptions, inventories, etc. Every stock operation in OpenERP moves the products from one location to another one. For instance, if you receive products from a supplier, OpenERP will move products from the Supplier location to the Stock location. Each report can be performed on physical, partner or virtual locations.
stock.location.tree stock.location tree child_ids
Location Structure stock.location ir.actions.act_window [('location_id','=',False)] tree
This is the structure of your company's warehouses and locations. You can click on a location to get the list of the products and their stock level in this particular location and all its children.
stock.warehouse stock.warehouse form
stock.warehouse.tree stock.warehouse tree
Warehouses stock.warehouse ir.actions.act_window form
Create and manage your warehouses and assign them a location from here
stock.picking.calendar stock.picking calendar
stock.picking.tree stock.picking tree
stock.picking.form stock.picking form
stock.picking.internal.search stock.picking search
Internal Moves stock.picking ir.actions.act_window form tree,form,calendar [('type','=','internal')] {'contact_display': 'partner_address', 'search_default_available': 1}
Internal Moves display all inventory operations you have to perform in your warehouse. All operations can be categorized into stock journals, so that each worker has his own list of operations to perform in his own journal. Most operations are prepared automatically by OpenERP according to your preconfigured logistics rules, but you can also record manual stock operations.
tree
form

stock.picking.out.form stock.picking.out
form
stock.picking.out.search stock.picking search
Delivery Orders stock.picking.out ir.actions.act_window form tree,form,calendar [('type','=','out')] {'default_type': 'out', 'contact_display': 'partner_address'}
This is the list of all delivery orders that have to be prepared, according to your different sales orders and your logistics rules.

form
calendar
stock.picking.in.tree stock.picking.in tree
stock.picking.in.form stock.picking.in
form
stock.picking.in.search stock.picking.in search
Incoming Shipments stock.picking.in ir.actions.act_window form tree,form,calendar [('type','=','in')] {'contact_display': 'partner_address', 'default_type': 'in'}
The Incoming Shipments is the list of all orders you will receive from your suppliers. An incoming shipment contains a list of products to be received according to the original purchase order. You can validate the shipment totally or partially.
tree
form
calendar
stock.move.tree stock.move tree
stock.move.form stock.move form
stock.move.search stock.move search
Stock Moves stock.move ir.actions.act_window form
{} This menu gives you the full traceability of inventory operations on a specific product. You can filter on the product to see all the past or future movements for the product.
==================================== Reception Picking (By Stock Move) ====================================
stock.move.tree2 stock.move tree
stock.move.tree3 stock.move tree
stock.move.form2 stock.move form
stock.move.incoming.search2 stock.move search
stock.move.outgoing.search2 stock.move search
Receive Products stock.move ir.actions.act_window form tree,form ['|','&',('picking_id','=',False),('location_id.usage', 'in', ['customer','supplier']),'&',('picking_id','!=',False),('picking_id.type','=','in')]
Here you can receive individual products, no matter what purchase order or picking order they come from. You will find the list of all products you are waiting for. Once you receive an order, you can filter based on the name of the supplier or the purchase order reference. Then you can confirm all products received using the buttons on the right of each line.
tree
form
# ------------------------------------------------------------- # Stock incoterms # -------------------------------------------------------------
stock.incoterms.tree stock.incoterms tree
stock.incoterms.form stock.incoterms form
Incoterms stock.incoterms ir.actions.act_window form tree,form
tree_but_open stock.location Products
tree_but_open stock.location Open Products
Customers Packings stock.picking ir.actions.act_window form tree,form,calendar [('type','=','out')] {'default_type': 'out', 'contact_display': 'partner',"search_default_available":1}
tree
form
calendar
Deliver Products stock.move ir.actions.act_window form tree,form ['|','&',('picking_id','=',False),('location_dest_id.usage', 'in', ['customer','supplier']),'&',('picking_id','!=',False),('picking_id.type','=','out')]
You will find in this list all products you have to deliver to your customers. You can process the deliveries directly from this list using the buttons on the right of each line. You can filter the products to deliver by customer, products or sale order (using the Origin field).
tree
form
stock.journal.filter stock.journal search
Stock Journals stock.journal tree
Stock Journals stock.journal form
Stock Journals stock.journal ir.actions.act_window form The stock journal system allows you to assign each stock operation to a specific journal according to the type of operation to perform or the worker/team that should perform the operation. Examples of stock journals may be: quality control, pick lists, packing, etc.
Stock Management
